questions.question: Is the image presented as a rectangular card with defined borders and structured layout resembling an RPG collectible?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the format and layout with defined edges, a title at the top, nameplate at the bottom, and various labeled areas for stats give it the appearance of a collectible card, characteristic of an RPG style.

questions.question: Is the name "Kaitiaki of the Valleys" displayed on the card, either in a nameplate or title area?
questions.explanation: Image B shows a title at the top that states 'KAITTIIAAY of THE VALLEYS', which strongly resembles 'Kaitiaki of the Valleys', indicating the intention to depict a similar name.

questions.question: Are the bold moko patterns on the warrior's face and body clearly visible and unchanged from the original?
questions.explanation: The warrior in Image B carries distinct moko patterns similar to those observed in Image A; hence they are visible and consistent.

questions.question: Is the flax piupiu skirt still present and accurately depicted on the warrior?
questions.explanation: The warrior in Image B is shown wearing a traditional skirt similar in style to a piupiu with attention to detail as seen in Image A.

questions.question: Is the warrior in a wide, dynamic stance with legs apart and arms outstretched, consistent with a haka pose?
questions.explanation: In both images, the warrior is depicted with legs apart and arms extended, consistent with a haka or similar expressive posture.

questions.question: Does the artwork use a stylized 3D rendering style with rich earthy tones (e.g., deep greens, browns, tans) throughout the character and environment?
questions.explanation: The image shows a 3D digital art style with vivid colors like greens for the valley and browns for the clothing, showcasing rich, earthy tones.

questions.question: Is the background composed of a layered, lush green valley with visible depth and multiple mountain ridges?
questions.explanation: The background in Image B presents a rich, textured valley with depth and several mountain ridges, giving a sense of dimension and lushness.

questions.question: Are four stat bars clearly visible with the labels [Courage +10], [Mana +9], [Rhythm +8], and [Leadership +7]?
questions.explanation: Image B does not show four stat bars with the specified labels. Instead, it features two bars with different names and values.

questions.question: Is there a banner at the top of the card with a carved-wood appearance and text indicating the character's title?
questions.explanation: A banner at the top of Image B has a wood-carved look and signifies a name/title, aligning with a characteristic card layout.

questions.question: Is there a nameplate located below the warrior that displays the name "Kaitiaki of the Valleys"?
questions.explanation: The text below in Image B does not display 'Kaitiaki of the Valleys'; instead, it seems to resemble some other text.

questions.question: Does the card have a border with a polished metallic finish around its edges?
questions.explanation: The card design in Image B involves a well-defined border which appears to mimic a polished metallic finish, enhancing the collectible card look.
